label: Description
value: A tower on a high elevation in the background, with a stream flowing through a chasm at lower right.

Niagara Falls from the Canadian Side

value: View of Niagara Falls from the Canadian side, with the American Falls in the background and the Horseshoe Falls at right.

View of Venice from the Grand Canal

label: Description
value: View of Venice from the Grand Canal, with boats and figures at right.

value: Etching in black ink on paper
Bridge over the Bushkill River, Easton, Pennsylvania

label: Description
value: View of the river with a small arched bridge, and a mill visible on the right.

value: Etching in black ink on paper

value: View of a New York City farm, with a vegetable garden, surrounded by tenements.

The Cliff Dwellers of New York

label: Description
value: View of rickety structures on rocks with tenement buildings in the background.

value: Etching and scotch stone tone in brown ink on paper
Twixt the Gloaming and the Mirk

label: Description
value: View of a country bridge across a small stream. Barn roofs and a windmill in the distance.

value: Etching and mezzotint, printed with plate tone in brown ink on paper

label: Description
value: Repeats of a flowering plant in grey on a blue ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: plain compound satin with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Horizontal bands wide and narrow. Wide bands are warp-patterned in a light color on either blue or brown background. Other colors are tan and dark red. Fragment probably from a bag.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: warp-faced plain weave patterned by warp floats and stripes

label: Description
value: Woven Coptic roundel showing concentric circles with an animal head at center; pairs of animals crowned by a three-headed bird with a heart on its breast. Soumak used for outlines. One weft carried at a time.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen warp, wool weft Technique: plain weave with discontinuous weft (slit tapestry), soumak

label: Provenance
value: Purchased in memory of Jacques Seligmann

label: Description
value: Length of tapestry band. Pattern consists of vertical arrangement of figures on orange center band at right angles to the warp. Figures of a standing man in a tunic waving an object with left hand raised alternate with an equestrian figure. All figures are greatly foreshortened, "squashed down" and misshapen. Horses are alternately pink and green. Outer borders of band red with tapestry woven undyed spirals at edges against the red ground.

label: Description
value: Five tapestry-woven strips stitched together with highly stylized snake design in tan and dark brown on red background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: slit tapestry

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 61.3 x 19.2 cm (24 1/8 x 7 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Mantle fragment of interlocking squares with geometric designs of birds and fish.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: tapestry, single interlock with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. View of the inside of the New Theater in Philadelphia, looking toward the stage and boxes.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. View of dock area looking toward river. City in distnace. Piles of merchandise at left and right. Horse-drawn wagon, center. At upper left in ink: "Wall Street Ferry 1867– G. Reynolds." Heavy ink border, three sides.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink on white paper with blue horizontal lines

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. View of a street, with tenement houses. Sketches below, and to right, of figures. At lower left, in pencil: "J. S. Hodgson Hersey St. N.Y. Rear of Niblo's Garden."

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. An arch above a pair of Corinthian columns. Emblems surround the archway: "Brother you are desired to meet the Master, and Brethren of No. Ancient York-Masons..."

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with black ink on white paper

label: Description
value: Vertical format. Exterior view of an architectural design for theater. The portico is shown, in Roman Doric style, with six columns. Three figures standing on the porch. The rest of the building is enveloped in clouds, also above building. At lower left: "A. J. Davis del.;" lower center: "W. Hooker Printer;" lower right: "Rawden, Wright and Co. Sc N. York;" "Sera Arch." Caption below.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with etching, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Two misers are seen seated at a table counting their fortune. The figure of Death plunges an arrow in the bosom of the one.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with black ink on white paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Thirteen vignettes of octagonal shape, showing Japanese landscapes. To be used either for decoupage or for motifs for painted tole-ware.

label: Physical description
value: Brown ink and watercolor on cream-colored paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Vignette of Senate Chamber interior, looking toward the Speaker's podium. Below: plan of the chamber, with names of members indicated. Caption: "Senate Chamber Harrisburg 1850." Enclosed in ornamental frame. Lower left: "Pubished by S.T. Williams." Lower right: Lith. of A. Kollner Phile H. Camp litho press."

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph with black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Vignette view of stage. A woman seated at a pianoforte and three others standing at left, all in similar costumes. Malone Raymond stands before a music-stand at right. Caption: "Mr. Malone Raymond and Family." At lower right: "J. H. Bufford's lith."

label: Physical description
value: Lithograph with black ink on white paper
Discord: The Good and the Bad Household

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Interior, with men and women reacting violently toward one another amidst a scene of confusion. In the foreground a woman, at left, swings her keys toward a man holding a knife. In the background two couples are battling. Title in plate above, center. At lower left: "M. de Vos figuravit." At lower right: "Crisp. van de Pass Sculp. et excud. A. 1589." Followed by proverb in three languages.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with black ink on paper

label: Description
value: A design on squared paper, of a border of stylized acanthus leaves in shades of green against a background of three bands of red, shaded from vermilion to maroon.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on pre-printed squared paper
Theater Interior with a Tight-Rope Walker

label: Description
value: Horizontal format. View of stage, seen from orchestra. A figure of a man is performing on a tight rope. Audience partially seen below. Two monkeys seated in box at right.

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. View looking toward the dock, with warehouses. Two boats at left, and one at extremes right, partially seen.

label: Description
value: Printed in imitation of irisé, or rainbow paper. The design is based on a horizontal figure, roughly hexagonal outlined in green. Vertical panels are formed by the arrangement of these figures vertically, the centers of one column of hexagonals being yellow and the adjoining hexagonals having lavender centers. The design is rendered in wavy foliate outlines. Printed in yellow, lavender, green, light green and dark green on a white ground.

label: Provenance
value: Unused length of wallpaper hung in a house in Richmond, Massachusetts. Built in 1790 by Nathan Peirson.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Cyrus W. Mace through kindness of Joseph Holton Jones

label: Description
value: Bedcover in cream-colored cotton with crewel embroidery in blue wool. Diamond-shaped center design framing flower clusters; detached designs of flowers and foliage. Wide borders for sides, vine and birds, and a separate drop for the foot of the bed in the same design.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: crewel embroidery on linen

label: Description
value: Bedcover with crewel embroidery in various shades of blue, yellow, pink and olive green on a linen ground. Design is similar to English crewel work and shows an East Indian influence. Long delicate center stem has flowers and sprays which extend to form borders.

label: Description
value: Panel of perforated white paper embroidered in colored wool with the words: "Glaube Liebe Hoffnung." At center is a heart, cross and anchor. Vine and foliage.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool embroidery on punched paper foundation Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Miss Wilhelmina L. Kechner

label: Description
value: On glazed rectangular face, a relief representing S. John with the lamb within a decorated arch. The remainder of the tile, including the heavy box-like projection behind the face, is unglazed.
